intro: Brodiaea sessilis, commonly known as the sessile brodiaea, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its compact, bulbous underground stem. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped, white or pale blue flowers during the spring and early summer. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often forming a basal rosette. Brodiaea sessilis is adapted to dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands.
